div.p: This webpage contains information on a variety of topics related to coronavirus (COVID-19). Up-to-date information about this virus should be obtained from the Center for Disease Control (CDC), the Allegheny County Health Department (ACHD), and the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

div.p: There is currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus. These everyday preventive actions are adapted from the CDC to help prevent the spread of respiratory diseases:

ul.li: Practice social distancing, as directed by the CDC, Department of Health and Governor of Pennsylvania.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.
Stay home and keep children home from school when sick. Follow your physician and ACHD guidelines regarding returning to work/school following illness.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.

Follow CDC’s recommendations for using a face mask.
Facemasks or cloth face coverings should be worn when venturing outside of your home.

Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.
If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.

div.p: In addition, the CDC and other public health agencies recommend that all persons 6 months and older receive a flu shot.

ul.li: Beginning Monday, March 16, 2020, the District buildings will be closed to students and non-essential employees until further notice.
WPIAL and extra-curricular activities will be halted during this time as well.
Chartiers Valley School District cleaning supplies all meet CDC requirements and are in good supply.
In addition to our regular thorough cleaning, custodians are using extra care to wipe-down high contact surfaces on a daily basis.
Good hygiene is being reinforced with all students and staff. Elementary students are receiving reminders regarding hand washing and respiratory etiquette.
The District has revised its process for enrolling new students into our schools that inquires about any recent travel out of the country. ​​​​​

div.p: Sometimes we underestimate how deeply children internalize what they are hearing when events, such as a virus that spreads world-wide, occur. Below are resources that can help you have a discussion with your child about any fears and worries they may have about the coronavirus and how they are processing what they are hearing on the news.

div.p: On Thursday, April 20, 2020, Governor Tom Wolf and PA Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine extended the state-wide school closure through the remainder of the academic year (governor.pa.gov).
CVSD schools and facilities will remain closed, and the District will continue to move forward with the Continuity of Education Plan.
Please visit the COVID-19 Information page under the COVID-19 tab for the April 20, 2020 letter from Superintendent Dr. Vanatta regarding prom and graduation.
